title: HiFiMAN - Shangri-La Jr
description:
Chi-Fi Excellence

Balanced Sound Signature

1 Year of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Metal Build

Open-Back Design

Electrostatic Drivers

Needs Amplification

Replaceable Cables

Description

EXPERIENCE A MYRIAD OF EMOTIONS AND A RANGE OF FREQUENCIES WITH SUPERIOR SONIC STABILITY

The HiFiMAN - Shangri-La Jr gives you a sound that is smooth and organic. Not only the vocals, even the instruments convey every emotion as you hear them in their finest detail. The super-wide soundstage lets you feel your music come alive. Enjoy music that flows through a range of frequencies from 7Hz to 120KHz. Like the diaphragm, even the metal mesh stators have a super-fine grating that let sound waves lower than 1 million hertz pass through without any distortion. The stators are crafted using a specialised metallic alloy. This gives you sonic stability with acoustically transparent audio.

HIGHLY OPTIMIZED THIN DIAPHRAGM FOR CLEAR SOUND

For the best sound experience, the HiFiMAN - Shangri-La Jr comes with a diaphragm that is so fine (0.001mm), it is thinner than a strand of human hair. It has a nanoparticle coating which enables it to move extremely fast and gives you an unsurpassed high-frequency response.

6SN7N VACUUM TUBES FOR A WARM SOUND

It’s not just the HiFiMAN - Shangri-La Jr that creates the magic you listen to but also the amp that comes with it. This amplifier has the finest hand-matched 6SN7N vacuum tubes. These tubes function closely to the output and give you a warm luxurious sound quality, one at par only with the best.

24-STEP ATTENUATOR FOR PRECISION

Say goodbye to noise, even during the slightest change in volume. The 24-step attenuator ensures that there is no added distortion in the system.

DESIGNED KEEPING YOUR UTMOST COMFORT IN MIND

The HiFiMAN - Shangri-La Jr has been designed keeping in mind long music-listening sessions. The headphone is lightweight while the soft headband is adjustable and ensures supreme comfort. The open-backed design gives you a view of the driver hard at work. The sleek look of the amp enhances any tabletop. Visitors are certainly going to come over for a second look.

SPECS

AUDIO SPECIFICATIONS

DRIVER TYPE
Nanotech Driver

7Hz - 12kHz

CONTROLS & CONNECTIVITY

COMPATIBILITY

DESIGN & BUILD

HEADPHONE STYLE

WEIGHT
13.2oz (374g)

DIMENSIONS
400 x 265 x 108 mm3 (15.7" x 10.4" x 4.2")

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS
1. HiFiMan Shangri-La headphone

2. HiFiMan Shangri-La Jr Electrostatic Amp

3. HiFiMan booklet

4. Storage case

FAQs

What is the warranty period for this product?

The warranty period on all HiFiMAN comes with a 1 year warranty. To claim warranty read more here.

What is the difference between the HiFiMAN - Shangri-La and HiFiMAN - Shangri-La Jr?

In a nutshell: The HiFiMAN Shangri-La has a 300B vacuum tube amp while the HiFiMAN Shangri-La Jr has a 6SN7N vacuum tube amp. An important decision. Choose wisely.

Electrostatic...hmmm...is there any danger of getting a shock?

No, these headphones are absolutely safe and you do not need to worry about getting a shock. There are many resistors to keep the current low. There is also a relay-based system that cuts off the output if there is any problem in the amp.

Is there any risk of arcing?

Arcing is a situation when the voltage passing through the headphone increases suddenly and is transferred from one electrode to the diaphragm/ other electrode. This can cause heavy damage to the driver unit. Fortunately, the Shangri-La jr comes with a nanometer-thick dust cover that prevents arcing.

WARRANTY & MEDIA REVIEWS

1 Year Warranty
Don't sweat it, this HiFiMAN Shangri-La Jr comes with a 1 year warranty from HiFiMAN that covers manufacturing defects. All products featured on Headphone Zone are backed by an original manufacturer's warranty. Read more about HiFiMAN's warranty in India.

BEST OPEN HEADPHONES 2021
HEADFONICS Dec, 2021

title: Chord - Qutest
description:
Designed in the UK

3 Years of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Indoor Use

FPGA DAC Chip

Metal Build

Pair with Laptop via USB

Connect With USB, BNC & Optical

The Chord Qutest is pretty much my favourite DAC. Period. For about a lakh, I don't think I like any other DAC quite the same way. Sure, some might be technically better, some might have better test results. But music doesn't sound the same on anything else.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.

DESCRIPTION

UPGRADE YOUR HOME SET-UP'S SOUND

Unlike other DACs by Chord Electronics, the Qutest does not have headphone amplification or rechargeable batteries. It is a pure DAC made to improve your home listening set-up. With its FPGA DAC, you get superior technical and sonic performance. With 49,152 taps, this DAC is able to support even Native DSD 512 (Octa-DSD).

MULTIPLE CONNECTIVITY OPTIONS

Connect to a wide variety of devices with the Qutest’s optical, 2 BNC Coax and USB Type-B digital inputs. These are galvanically isolated to give an instant performance upgrade as well as to modernise ageing digital source components. Connect to future Chord Electronics devices with Hi-Res dual-data digital inputs. RCA analogue outputs let you connect to headphone amps, preamps and integrated amps.

SUPPORTS ALL YOUR CHOICES

The Qutest lets you select from its four frequency-shaping filters and input selection controls. This can be done via the two fascia-mounted spheres. You can also choose whether you want the output voltage to be 1, 2 or 3 RMS for connecting to a range of devices. It supports a wide range of frequencies like 44.1kHz, 48kHz, 88.2kHz, 96kHz, 176.4kHz, 192kHz, 358.8kHz, 384kHz, 717.6kHz and 768kHz.

HIGH-QUALITY, DURABLE ALUMINIUM CASING

The Qutest sports a show-off-worthy chassis. This all-new chassis has been precision-machined from solid aircraft-grade aluminium for better durability. The PCB has been kept in a shallow cavity in the casing for additional isolation and protection from external vibration.

SPECS

GENERAL SPECIFICATIONS

DEVICE POWER SUPPLY

DSD SUPPORT

DRIVER SUPPORT

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS

2. 5V 2A Switching Micro USB power supply

3. Type-A USB to Type-B USB cable

4. Drawstring bag

5. Qutest user manual

6. Safety instructions

FAQS

What is a DAC?

A DAC is a processor that converts digital audio information (consisting of a series of 0s and 1s) into an analogue audio signal. This gives you a better sound quality.

Does the Qutest serve as an amp too?

No, it doesn’t. The Qutest is a standalone DAC that is dedicated only to give you a great sound.

Is it compatible with Mac and Windows?

The Quetest has driverless support for Mac OS X and Linux. You will be required to install a supported driver to use it with your PC.

title: Audio-Technica - ATH-M50x
description:
Designed in Japan

Flat Sound Signature

3 Years of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

For Studio & Professionals

Needs Amplification

45mm Dynamic Drivers

Closed-Back Design

Replaceable Cables

The Audio-Technica ATH-M50x isn’t going anywhere; the style, comfort and great sound are what makes these headphones a great buy. If you're looking for an all-around solid pair of headphones you can use for mixing, recording and monitoring, ATH-M50x is a great pick.

PRAVEEN KAMATH
Headphone Guru

About PRAVEEN KAMATH
Praveen, our Headphone Zone is an audio connoisseur and staunch Meze fanboy. He loves the RAI Penta and the Empyrean, equally. When not writing about, thinking about or listening to music: He's an avid beerologist too and staunchly believes that the combination of both beats every music setup out there! You'll often find him listening to The Weeknd, The Score and The Script.

DESCRIPTION

THE OVERACHIEVER AMONGST ALL ITS M-SERIES SIBLING

As the most critically acclaimed model in the M-Series line, THE M50x hits the right spot when it comes to delivering a balanced sound. It seals your music in tightly with their contoured earcups, isolating all the ambient noise with no sound leakage, with minimal bleed. One of the top picks of online reviewers, top audio engineers, and cult followers agree, the M50x is an unmatched combination of audio and build-quality that gets the job done. Hour after hour, year after year.

HANDLES ANYTHING YOU THROW AT IT

The M50x produces stupendously clear, clean and most of all, accurately balanced and rich throughout the frequency spectrum making them an ideal studio headphones for listening to all types of genres. You can distinctly hear bright sounding vocals and instrumentals in one single track.

SUPERIOR SONIC PERFORMANCE BY 45MM CUSTOM TUNED DRIVERS

The drivers used in the Audio Technica ATH-M50x are 45mm large and custom made drivers with copper-coated aluminum voice coils and rare-earth magnets. M50x creates a large sense of scale that’s obviously the exact opposite of cluttered and muddy-sounding audio.

CUTTING-EDGE ENGINEERING AND ROBUST CONSTRUCTION

The M50x, even though made of plastic, is known for its use of high quality textured matte construction and overall solid durability. The Pro grade material has been used for the ear cups as well as the headband.

90° SWIVELING CLOSED-BACK EARCUPS FOR ONE-EAR MONITORING

Circumaural design contours around the ears for excellent sound isolation in loud environments. 90° rotating ear cups ensure you can do some critical listening, one ear at a time.

STRAIGHT AND COILED SINGLE SIDED CABLE OPTIONS TO CHOOSE FROM

The M50x includes three cable options: 1.2m - 3.0m coiled cable, 1.2m straight and 3.0 m straight cable. The 3m straight single-side cable is designed to make these studio headphones convenient for studio tracking, mixing and field recording. They are very convenient in terms of usage and make life simple. Making them the top choice for studio tracking and mixing, as well as DJ monitoring and personal listening.

FAQs

What is the warranty period on Audio-Technica ATH-M50x and how do I claim warranty?

The warranty period is 3 Years from the date of invoice for all M-Series and E-Series (Pro Products). In order to claim warranty, please visit our Audio-Technica warranty page. We are very helpful guys, just saying.

The sound signature of the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x is?

Very flat. Essentially made for professional studio monitoring, you can expect a neutral sound from the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x. Bassheads, leave now before you set yourself up for disappointment.

Is the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x ideal for DJs?

No, they are not. You can have a look at the V-MODA Crossfade LP2 as it is ideal for DJ and live shows.

Does the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x come with an open-back design?

No, it doesn’t. If you are looking for a wide soundstage our top recommendation will be the Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro. It features an open-back design with much more detailing as compared to the ATH-M50x.

Will Audio-Technica ATH-M50x require an Amp?

Although your smartphone and laptop will be able to drive it, an amplifier would certainly bring out the true potential of the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x. Read more about amplification and why it's important here.

What is the difference between the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x and the Beyerdynamic DT770 Pro?

The Beyerdynamic DT770 Pro will have a flatter response, as accurate to the source as possible. The Audio-Technica ATH-M50x will have relatively extended low end in comparison.

Does detachable cable mean I can use it without the wire as well?

No, they can’t. Detachable cables mean they can be replaced when they go south!

Are Audio-Technica ATH-M50x built to last? Could I use it when travelling?

Yes, they are durable and are travel friendly since they fold and a travel carry pouch is also included with the product.

Could I change the parts if they wear out?

Yes, we provide high quality replacement parts for the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x. You can replace the headband and the earpads from Headphone Zone directly.

How many cables does the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x come with?

The product comes with 3 cables: 3.9 to 9.8' (1.2 to 3 m) Coiled Cable, 9.8' (3 m) Straight Cable and 3.9' (1.2 m) Straight Cable. Who doesn't like options?

What devices is the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x compatible with?

These headphones are mostly used by studio professionals and come with a 6.3mm adaptor for use with consoles. You can also use the 3.5mm jack with your laptop or smartphone.

Is Audio-Technica ATH-M50x an ideal product for everyday casual use?

Ideally no. Because these require a dedicated amp for the best quality and because they're quite flat sounding, we wouldn't recommend these to casual music listeners.

How do Audio-Technica ATH-M50x stack up against Ultrasone Performance 820?

Both these headphones are flagship products under the 10k range having their strenghts and usability. To help understand better we have an easy to understand blog comparing the Audio Technica M50x vs Ultrasone Performance 820 here.

title: iFi Audio - Mercury 3.0
description:
DESCRIPTION

HIGH-QUALITY MATERIALS FOR OPTIMAL PERFORMANCE

The Mercury 3.0 has been crafted by expert engineers who have used only high-quality materials. It uses heavy OFHC continuous copper silver matrix conductors that have end-to-end shielding for the cable. The Final USB connectors have been machined from aircraft-grade aluminium and used gold-plated connections for extra durability.

NOT YOUR AVERAGE USB CABLE

Unlike common USB cables that come with barely any shielding, the Mercury 3.0 has a quadruple shielding that entirely separates and protects the USB signal from any power interference. This reduces EMI and RFI cable noise and gives you the cleanest audio you can possibly get.

SHHH... ONLY PURE SOUND

The Mercury 3.0 has 3 custom-made metal oxide ceramic RF noise silencers. Since each filter has a different effective range, the RF noise is silenced over a wider range. While 2 silencers are fixed at opposite ends of the range, the middle one is adjustable and can be moved along the entire length of the cable. This detunes the antennae formed by the cable and further reduces noise.

FASTER, SMOOTHER, HIGHER STANDARDS

Enjoy a faster and smoother audio experience with the Mercury 3.0. This USB cable is crafted with high-quality cables and connectors. This ensures a higher standard transmission platform and a less jittery audio & power transfer. (PS: The Mercury 3.0 can support a bandwidth speed of 5.0Gbps which makes it future-proof).

title: Campfire Audio - Litz Cable
description:
DESCRIPTION

THE PERFECT CABLE FOR YOUR IEMS

Upgrade your IEMs with the Campfire Audio Litz Cable. This cable consists of four silver-plated copper conductors. Each wire is individually enamelled. A flexible and durable jacket reduces microphonics and makes it a joy to be used. It features custom Beryllium Copper MMCX connectors that offer a robust mating mechanism as well as extends the life of the earphone.

MULTIPLE CONNECTIVITY OPTIONS

Connect your IEM to a variety of devices with the different terminations available: 3.5mm Stereo Plug: For use with the standard 3.5mm output of just about any portable audio device. 4.4mm 5-Pole Balanced: For use with high-end Sony digital audio players. Other devices are expected to include this output in the near future. 2.5mm 4-Pole Balanced: For use with hi-res DAPs from brands like Astell&Kern, Lottoo, etc. 3.5mm with Mic: For use with any Android device. Comes with an inline 3-button remote & mic.

description:
Designed & Made in USA

Ideal for Audiophiles

For Studio & Professionals

Closed-Back Design

The Audeze LCD2C is still the greatest Planar Magnetic Headphones in this segment. The bass and warmth that you'd expect from an Audeze make them ideal for anyone starting their journey and looking for serious high-end headphones. Pair it with a good desktop Amp to make them sing.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.

DESCRIPTION

PERFECT COMBO: ACCURATE SOUND + NOISE ISOLATION

The LCD-2 is the legendary headphone that made Audeze an industry leader. The brand has transferred this award-winning sound into a closed-back design. This reduces ambient sound, isolating you from the rest of the world. This is the perfect blend between audiophile-grade sound and superior noise isolation.

DEEP & CONTROLLED BASS WITH PLANAR MAGNETIC DRIVERS

Experience Audeze’s proprietary planar magnetic technology. You get a powerful bass that’s deep and controlled. The ultra thin-film diaphragm ensures super-low distortion that brings out every delicate nuance in your music. The LCD2 Closed-Back delivers a rich as well as accurate sound.

MIX & MASTER ANYWHERE & EVERYWHERE

Not everyone can listen to their headphones in an acoustically treated room. With the Audeze Reveal plugin, you can add custom filter presets to all Audeze flagships. Now, mix and master in virtually any location, be it the studio, your home or even on top of an active volcano.

HANDCRAFTED WITH PREMIUM MATERIALS

Made in the USA, the Audeze LCD-2 Closed-Back are handcrafted using high-quality luxurious materials. It features Audeze's tonal balance and powerful bass that beautifully articulates the power and nuance of your favourite music. The gorgeous wooden rings are designed for the audiophile with a discerning ear & style.

DESCRIPTION

HIGHLY OPTIMIZED EFFICIENT PLANAR MAGNETIC DRIVERS

The Susvara has planar magnetic drivers that give you great sound. The diaphragm of this driver is ultra-thin i.e. less than the millionth of a metre. This gives you audio that is detailed and has super-low distortion. Experience your music with every detail come alive.

SOUND, PURE SOUND AND NOTHING BUT SOUND

Unlike other Planar Magnetic headphones where the magnet gets in the way of the soundwaves and causes interference, the special design used in the Susvara’s magnet lets the sound waves pass seamlessly through without any disturbance. This lowers distortion and gives you a more pure and harmonious sound.

PLANAR EXCELLENCE WITH STUNNING EYE-CATCHING LOOKS

Created especially for an open-back headphone, the Window Shade Grill Design protects the driver while reducing sonic reflections and giving you a clearer sound. Along with unadulterated clean audio, this design also adds to your headphone’s stunning looks.

DESIGNED KEEPING YOUR UTMOST COMFORT IN MIND

The Susvara not only looks and sounds good, it is also super-comfortable. The adjustable headband fits snugly and keeps the headphone in place while the ear pads ensure that even hours of listening sessions will be fatigue-free.

HiFiMAN certainly has the pedigree of making high-end audiophile headphones. The RE400 is remarkably well built earphone.They sound incredibly well detailed and balanced as compared to others in this price point.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.

DESCRIPTION

ANDROID COMPATIBILITY WITH 3.5MM JACK ALONG WITH MIC AND 1-BUTTON REMOTE

The RE400 comes fully compatible with Android devices featuring a 3.5mm connector with a microphone delivering the best audio reproduction. The embedded microphone is a high-quality mic capable of transmitting clean audio.

CUSTOM-TUNED 8.5MM TITANIUM-COATED DRIVERS

While most companies selling in-ear headphones buy their drivers from outside suppliers, the RE-400's 8.5mm titanium-coated drivers were designed by HiFiMan engineers and are the company's own creation. Thus, making sure that everything is on par with their company standards. Impedance is rated at 32 ohms hence allowing easier connectivity. These custom drivers deliver the best in class audio performance and extended frequency response.

ERGONOMIC DESIGNED ALUMINIUM EARPIECES WITH HIGH QUALITY COPPER CABLES

Ergonomically designed, these earphones deliver the most comfortable fit for extended listening hours without causing fatigue. These earphones have an attractive, understated design with machined-aluminum earpieces. The 50-inch-long, neodymium magnets and premium cabling of oxygen free copper cable which ensures that your music is transmitted in its true form without causing any kind of distortion. The wires can either hang straight down or loop back over your ears.

CLASSY MONOCHROME DESIGN AND LIGHTWEIGHT BUILD

The earphones come in an extremely stylish looking design with a black body and silver accents. Convenient hands-free design allows you to talk on the phone clearly and safely at your home, office or on the road. The cable is wrapped up in rubber from the earbuds to the Y-splitter, thus making them very sturdy. The light weight design makes these IEM’s highly portable.

title: Astell&Kern - AK XB10
description:
Designed in Korea

1 Year of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Best Suited for Portable Use

Ideal for Taking Calls

Bluetooth with aptX HD & AAC

5 Hours of Battery Life

2.5mm Balanced Output

Multi-point Connection

Cirrus Logic CS4350 DAC Chip

Upto 1.8Vrms Power Output

Battery Capacity of 350 mAh

For an Audiophile looking to listen to music on the go with the convenience of their mobile phones, this is an absolutely priceless DAC. For me, the 2.5mm balanced output is what makes this a serious audiophile essential you can't go wrong with.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.

DESCRIPTION

A PORTABLE 24 BIT DAC/AMP THAT OFFERS 2 AUDIO OUTPUTS

The XB10 features a dedicated DAC that has been tuned using Astell&Kern's latest technologies and offers high-quality sound up to 24-bit/192 kHz. The amplifier drives just about any headphone while amplifying even the minutest of details. A standard-sized 3.5mm jack provides connectivity to maximum devices. The 2.5mm jack, on the other hand, is for those audio enthusiasts who are looking to enjoy a deeper level of sound. It eliminates ground noise and provides a balanced connection resulting in increased output.

STREAM HIGH-QUALITY AUDIO WITH BLUETOOTH CONNECTIVITY

The Astell&Kern XB10 is very flexible in terms of connectivity. It supports SBC, aptX™ and aptX™ HD codecs for Android devices and the AAC codec for iOS. Just turn on your smartphone, tablet or laptop's Bluetooth and you're good to go. Qualcomm aptX™ HD technology is capable of transmitting up to 24-bit/48 kHz audio that is faithful to the original audio file.

EMBEDDED WITH A MICROPHONE AND IN LINE CONTROLS

The XB10 is a game-changer providing solutions to all your problems. Along with high-quality music, it also lets you answer calls without having to access your phone. Answering/Declining calls just requires the tap of a button while the inbuilt mic makes for crystal-clear calls.

EASY TO CARRY LIGHTWEIGHT AND PORTABLE DESIGN

The XB10's design mimics the appearance of the scattering of light from a star. The surface is split into quadrants for easier operability. It is extremely lightweight and portable. Want to carry your music along? Simply clip the device to your shirt or bag and run along. The clip keeps your hands free and lets you flaunt Astell&Kern's classy light and shadow design.

FAQs

Whats the warranty period? How to claim warranty?

The warranty period on all Astell&Kern products is 1 year. Read more information on Astelle&Kern warranty.

What is the battery life of the Astell&Kern AK XB10?

The battery life lasts a good 5 hours of continuous music playback with a recharge time of 2 hours.

Could It be used with iOS devices as well?

Yes, the Astell&Kern AK XB10 is compatible with iOS devices using AAC codec as well with Android devices using aptX™ HD codecs.

What is AptX?

In Bluetooth some of the data is inaudible and it simply doesn't sound as good as audio transmitted over other wireless methods or a wired connection. But, in AptX there is a lossless transmission as it provides CD-like quality. AptX is good. Be like AptX!

What do you mean by aptX and AAC? Do they really make my music sound different?

AAC and aptX are Bluetooth codecs that improve the quality of audio that is being transferred wirelessly. To know more, check out this article on Bluetooth codecs.

Does this Bluetooth Amplifier come with any balanced outputs?

Yes, the Astell&Kern AK XB10 does come with a 2.5mm balanced output.

Can it be used with my headphones?

Yes, you connect your earphones and headphones through the 2.5mm and 3.5mm audio jack slots provided by Astell&Kern.

What Bluetooth version does Astell&Kern AK XB10 support?

The Astell&Kern AK XB10 comes with the Bluetooth version 4.1.

What is so great about the AK XB10?

Apart from it working as an amplifier it eliminates ground noise around you which in turn provides a better listening experience.

MITER Leather Case is handmade made in South Korea, for protecting your Astell & Kern AK300 AMP / AK320 AMP "on the go" from scratches, shocks, and fingerprints.
These cases are made with great attention to detail with excellent craftsmanship. What’s unique about this case is that you can accommodate both Astell & Kern AK300 player and the Amp in the same case and enjoy a high-resolution music on-the-go without worrying about ruining your player and Amp. Just like all of the MITER  cases the AK300/AK 200 AMP has a patented steel frame and case cover because your exquisite devices deserve unique design.
With a distinctive durable design protect both your player and the amp in one case which not only makes it highly portable but also ensures the protection of your musical enticements.
Superior Premium Materials
This case is available in two finishes:
The Black case is made with Soft FG Leather that is used in high-quality football shoes that are roughly used. You can, therefore, be ensured that the leather is high quality and durable.
The Brown case is made with “Oil Pull-up” leather, a favorite of MITER, due to its beautiful matte finish, unique in its characteristics with respect to the oily finish different from other varieties of leathers.
Handcrafted in Korea
The MITER cases are handcrafted in Korea with great attention to detail by using premium quality leather and patented designs to make your case one of a kind, durable and classy.
High-Quality Protection from Shock, Fingerprints, and Scratches
The durable MITER cases protect your precious player from all things bad that could happen to your player. They protect the player from shock, fingerprints, and scratches so that you can have your music on the go without any worries.
Patented Steel Frame & Case Cover
MITER cases have a patented design for the steel frame and case cover because your unique music deserves a unique case.
Perfect Fit for your Player
They are custom made just for the Astell&Kerm AK300 player and prove to be the perfect fit just for your player.
sku: MITER - Astell&Kern - AK300 AMP & AK320 AMP Leather Case - Black

title: STAX - SRM-T8000
description:
DESCRIPTION

FIRST LARGE-SIZED TOROIDAL TRANSFORMER, CLEAR HIGH-QUALITY SOUND

The SRM-T8000 is the first driver unit by STAX that has a large-sized Toroidal Transformer. This reduces the leakage flux and helps in keeping noise low. It also leads to high-speed reproduction of sound across a wide frequency range. The SRM-T8000 uses a 6922 dual triode tube. These high-quality tubes are mounted on an independent board to eliminate vibration and noise.

STAY CONNECTED, HIGH-GRADE MATERIALS & LIGHTWEIGHT AND BEAUTIFUL

Now you can easily connect your earspeakers with this driver with 4 pairs of input (the fourth one is optional). These can bypass the volume controller letting you use the SRM-T8000 as an exclusive power amplifier. What does combining an aluminium insulator, vibration-proof material and high frictional coefficient lead to? Well, a really high amount of friction power. This, and other high-quality electronic parts, together give you great tone quality and performance. Unlike most driver units that have an iron chassis, the SRM-T8000 has a non-magnetic aluminium chassis. This has made the unit lighter while eliminating a cloudy tone quality. The aluminium also adds to its sleek look.

SPECS

AUDIO SPECIFICATIONS

FREQUENCY RESPONSE
1～115kHz per channel

TOTAL HARMONIC DISTORTION
<0.01% @1kHz per channel

GAIN
60dB

INPUT IMPEDANCE
Unbalanced 50kΩ/ Balanced: 50kΩx2

MAX. OUTPUT VOLATGE
470V r.m.s./1kHz

CONTROLS & CONNECTIVITY

HEADPHONE OUTPUT
Stax PRO bias output x2ation, Pure balance DC amplifier configuration Earspeaker driver unit

ANALOG INPUT
RCA x2、XLR x1

RATED INPUT LEVEL
100mV/100V

VACUUM TUBE
6922 ｘ2

POWER CONSUMPTION
95W（58W when idle）

VOLATGE
120V/60HZ

DESIGN & BUILD

EXTERNAL DIMENSIONS
320(W)×103(H)×395(D)mm / 12.6" x 4" x 15.6"

WEIGHT
7.3kg / 16.1 lbs

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS
1. Stax SRM-T8000 Driver Unit

FAQs

What sort of device is the SRM-T8000? Why do I need it?

The SRM-T8000 is a driver unit. A driver unit is like an amplifier. It converts electrical signals from your audio player into music when it reaches your headphones. It is mainly used for headphones and earphones that have a high impedance. Find out more here.

What are electrostatic earspeakers?

Electrostatic earspeakers are headphones that run on special electrodes that conduct electricity. Since these produce a sound that is only comparable to other loudspeakers (& not other headphones), they are known as earspeakers. Sounds cool right?

What is the warranty like and whom should I contact?

STAX offers a manufacturer’s warranty of 1 year. In case you need to claim warranty or want to read more about it, here’s the place you need to be.

WARRANTY AND MEDIA REVIEWS

1 Year Warranty
Don't sweat it, this STAX SRM-T8000 comes with a 1 year warranty from STAX that covers manufacturing defects. All products featured on Headphone Zone are backed by an original manufacturer's warranty. Read more about STAX's warranty in India.

"The SRM-T8000 is the best energiser Stax has ever made, and if resolution and imaging are your audio ‘triggers’, then this is also the best energiser you can get for a Stax."
Read More

"I can say that the combination of the SRM-T8000 amplifier and SR-009S headphones is enough to put any headphone/personal fi lover into regions of bliss."

title: HiFiMAN - Shangri-La
description:
Chi-Fi Excellence

Flat Sound Signature

1 Year of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Indoor Use

Open-Back Design

Electrostatic Drivers

Needs Amplification

DESCRIPTION

THE ULTIMATE FLAGSHIP EXPERIENCE

The Shangri-La is not just a headphone. It is a combination of an over-ear with a special tube amplifier that offers a sound worthy of it. This custom-made amp features the finest 300B tubes for an audio quality like none other.

24-SETUP LEVEL OF VOLUME CONTROL

Say goodbye to noise, even during the slightest change in volume. The 24-step level of volume control uses 23 separate resistors. This makes each volume level independent of the others.

HIGHLY OPTIMIZED THIN DIAPHRAGM FOR CLEAR SOUND

For the best sound experience, the Shangri-La comes with a diaphragm that is so fine (0.001mm), it is thinner than a strand of human hair. It has a nanoparticle coating which enables it to move extremely fast and gives you an unsurpassed high-frequency response.

DISTORTION FREE SUPERIOR SONIC EXPERIENCE

Enjoy music that flows through a range of frequencies from 7Hz to 120KHz. Like the diaphragm, even the metal mesh stators have a super-fine grating that let sound waves lower than 1 million hertz pass through without any distortion. The stators are crafted using a specialised metallic alloy. This gives you sonic stability with acoustically transparent audio.

EXPERIENCE 300B FOR REAL

Most headphones/amps come with transformers and capacitors to increase the voltage and drive the diaphragm. The Shangri-La has neither. Thus, nothing comes between the headphone and amp and you can directly listen to the four 300B vacuum tubes.

FLAGSHIP LEVEL COMFORT WITH SOFT HEADBAND, SPACIOUS EARPADS

The Shangri-La has been designed keeping in mind long music-listening sessions. The headphone is lightweight while the soft head pad is adjustable and ensures supreme comfort. The open-backed design gives you a view of the driver hard at work. Visitors are certainly going to come over for a second look.

SPECS

AUDIO SPECIFICATIONS

DRIVER TYPE
Nanotech Driver

FREQUENCY RESPONSE
7Hz - 12kHz

BIAS VOLTAGE
550-650V

CONTROLS & CONNECTIVITY

WIRED CONNECTIVITY
3.5mm

MICROPHONE
No

COMPATIBILITY
Universal

DESIGN & BUILD

WEARING STYLE
Over-Ear (Circumaural)

HEADPHONE STYLE
Open-Back

WEIGHT
13.2oz (374g)

DIMENSIONS
17.32" x 18.11" x 13.39" (437.8*458.9*335.8mm)

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS
1. HiFiMan Shangri-La headphone

2. HiFiMan Shangri-La Electrostatic Amp

3. HiFiMan booklet

FAQs

What is the warranty period for this product?

The warranty period on all HiFiMAN comes with a 1 year warranty. To claim warranty read more here.

What sort of headphone is this?

The Shangri-La is an electrostatic headphone. It uses a diaphragm that is statically charged and is repelled/attracted to the stators nearby. You can read more about it here.

Electrostatic...hmmm...is there any danger of getting a shock?

No, these headphones are absolutely safe and you do not need to worry about getting a shock. There are many resistors to keep the current low. There is also a relay-based system that cuts off the output if there is any problem in the amp.

What is the difference between the Shangri-La and Shangri-La jr?

In a nutshell: The Shangri-La has a 300B vacuum tube amp while the Shangri-La jr has a 6SN7N vacuum tube amp. An important decision. Choose wisely.

Is there any risk of arcing?

Arcing is a situation when the voltage passing through the headphone increases suddenly and is transferred from one electrode to the diaphragm/ other electrode. This can cause heavy damage to the driver unit. Fortunately, the Shangri-La comes with a nanometer-thick dust cover that prevents arcing.

Buying Guide

The World's Most Expensive Headphones You Won't Believe Exist
by Abhijeeth Shetty May 09, 2020
The sole purpose of these expensive headphones is to deliver the ultimate music listening experience which you won't find in low-end headphones.
Read More

title: STAX - SR-007MK2
description:
Designed in Japan

Flat Sound Signature

1 Year of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Indoor Use

Open-Back Design

Electrostatic Drivers

Needs Amplification

Tangle-Free Cables

DESCRIPTION

AN EARSPEAKER LIKE NO OTHER, RICH POWERFUL SOUND

The innovative SR-007MK2 is, like all other STAX headphones, an ultra-high fidelity device due to its electrostatic technology. However, unlike other STAX Earspeakers, it features a different design for its deep powerful sound and is hence, an Earspeaker like no other. The unique electrode structure has a gold-plated outer edge. Unlike other Earspeakers, these electrodes do not have any holes, causing the diaphragm to vibrate more. This not only gives you a rich powerful sound but also lets you experience the delicate details in your music.

RIGID METAL HOUSING, EXTREME COMFORT & HIGH-QUALITY AUDIO

To thoroughly eliminate distortion, STAX encases the sound element in a thick insulated resin case. This case is firmly attached to the SR-007MK2’s body. This makes sure that only the diaphragm vibrates, giving you a sound that’s almost magical. The SR-007MK2 is made for long listening sessions. The soft lambskin earpads are adjustable so that they fit your head perfectly. For a great sound, the SR-007MK2 uses a Pure Crystal Ohno Continuous Casting (PC-OCC) cable. This 2.5m (8.2 feet) cable has a low capacity and wide format which ensures that you only get high-quality audio when you plug it in.

SPECS

AUDIO SPECIFICATIONS

FREQUENCY RESPONSE
6 - 41,000Hz

IMPEDANCE
170k Ω (10kHz)

SENSITIVITY
100dB / 100V r.m.s. 1 kHz

BIAS VOLTAGE
580V DC

CONTROLS & CONNECTIVITY

TYPE
Push-Pull electrostatic circular sound element, Open-Air type enclosure

CAPACITANCE
94pF (including cable)

LEFT & RIGHT CHANNEL IDENTIFICATION
'L' and 'R' indicated on the cable entrance point, solid line (left) and dotted line (right) on the cable

CABLE
Low capacity wide format, PC-OCC (Pure Crystal Ohno Continuous Casting) 2.5m/8.2ft

AMBIENT TEMPREATURE AND HUMIDITY
0 to 35ºC / 90% max. without condensation

DESIGN & BUILD

EAR PADS
Genuine Lamb Leather (direct skin contact), high-quality synthetic leather (surrounding portion)

WEIGHT
12.9oz without cable / 1.1lb with cable

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS
1. STAX SR-007MK2

2. Hard Travel Case

FAQs

Is this an open or closed-backed headphone? Can I carry it along with me?

The SR-007MK2 is an open-backed headphone so it is certainly not the best option for a long commute. But if you’d prefer a headphone for listening at home, this should certainly be your pick. Still confused? Maybe this article could help you out.

What is the cable like?

The SR-007MK2 has a 2.5m wide Pure Crystal Ohno Continuous Casting (PC-OCC). It’s quality at its best!

What is the warranty like and whom should I contact?

STAX offers a manufacturer’s warranty of 1 year. In case you need to claim warranty or read more about it, here’s the place you need to be.

Can I use the SR-007MK2 with my phone?

Nope, you can’t. The STAX SR-007MK2 has an impedance of 145K Ohms. Headphones with higher impedance need more power to run and your smartphone won’t be able to generate that. You will need an amp for this. To understand more about impedance and its effect on your beloved headphone, check out this article.

title: HiFiMAN - Sundara (2022)
description:
Chi-Fi Excellence

Balanced Sound Signature

1 Year of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Metal Build

Open-Back Design

Planar Magnetic Drivers

Needs Amplification

Replaceable Cables

The Sundara has seen several changes over the years. But the latest version of the Sundara is perhaps the best. You need a serious amplifier to drive this planar magnetic headphone but paired properly, these are a fantastic headphone for any audiophile.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.

DESCRIPTION

SUSHEEL. SATEEK. SUNDARA.

Sundara has planar magnetic drivers that give you great sound. The diaphragm of this unit is 80% slimmer than the HE400 series. This gives you audio that traverses across a frequency range of 6Hz and 75KHz. Experience your music with every detail come alive.

SOUNDS EXACTLY LIKE IT SAYS ON THE BOX: SUNDARA

Just like its name means ‘beautiful’. Sundara’s lovely fashion-forward looks in no way compromise on build quality. If you favour a more reference tuning you will enjoy the Sundara a lot, they have excellent resolution and detail all wrapped up in a relatively refined and smooth presentation. The aluminium headband is lightweight but durable. The adjustable headband and earpads are made of synthetic leather and offer comfort of the highest order.

LOOKS AS GOOD AS IT SOUNDS

Just like its sound, HiFiMAN’s Sundara looks gorgeous too. Just leave them on a table and the matte black finish, as well as the earcup grills, are sure to grab eyeballs.

HIGHLY OPTIMIZED DRIVERS AND 3.5MM PLUG FOR MOBILITY

Be it your smartphone, laptop or even DAP, the Sundara can connect to just about any device. This is all thanks to the 3.5mm plug. HiFiMAN has not left any stone unturned to create this headphone and this includes that extra tinge of durability to make it last for long.

Experts Verdict
"Overall Sundara offer better detail and technical ability: soundstage is larger, imaging is more accurate. They offer a comfortable listening experience in terms of comfort, also in terms of sound." Soundphile Review

"The Ananda is great and looking purely at sound quality. The Ananda is very easy to like and I’m sure most of you will love its smooth delivery, musical mids and engaging bass." Headfonia

"The soundstage of the HiFiMAN - Arya is unleashed now, it feels borderless. The Ananda has very good spacing and defines space pretty accurate. Still a rare feat in its class." Head-Fi

FAQs

How to claim warranty for HiFiMAN Sundara?

All HiFiMAN products come with 1 year of warranty. To claim warranty read more on HiFiMAN warranty here.

How does the HiFiMAN Sundara sound?

The HiFiMAN Sundara comes with a Balanced sound signature focusing more on the mids with deep bass. Also, with the open back design the sound stage in the Sundara is wider and has great sound separation.

Does the HiFiMAN Sundara require an amp?

Although your smartphone and laptop will be able to drive it, an amplifier would certainly bring out the true potential of the HiFiMAN - Sundara. Read more about amplification and why it's important here.

Does the HiFiMAN Sundara come with detachable cables?

Yes, the cables are indeed detachable. Making for easy storage and convenient for whenever you want to replace or upgrade cables.

Can I use the HiFiMAN Sundara for long listening sessions?

The Sundara comes with extra soft earpads and it’s over-ear design makes them comfortable to wear for long hours.

Does the HiFiMAN Sundara comes with a mic?

No, the HiFiMAN Sundara does not come with a microphone.

What is the impedance on the HiFiMAN Sundara?

The HiFiMAN Sundara comes with an impedance of 37Ω.

What do “Impedance” and “Ohms” mean?

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Ω, 32 Ω, and 80 Ω are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Ω are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Ω.

title: Chord - Hugo 2 Slim Case
description:
DESCRIPTION

CARRY YOUR HUGO 2 ANYWHERE AND EVERYWHERE

Protect your Chord Hugo 2 from all kinds of external damage with the Chord Hugo 2 Leather Case. It has been designed and manufactured by Chord Electronics and specialist Japanese case maker, VanNyus Inc. in Tokyo. This handmade luxurious leather case has beautiful leather grain and contrasting red stitching.

PROVIDES EASY ACCESS TO YOUR HUGO 2

The Hugo 2 Leather Case offers a snug fit and protects your Hugo 2 at home and outdoors. It offers unrestricted access to the DAC/AMP’s double-ended connectivity suite and newly introduced top-mounted features, including the device’s control spheres, iconic viewing porthole and the volume control sphere.

title: Schiit - Lokius
description:
Designed & Made in the USA

2 Years of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Indoor Use

Connect With RCA

Metal Build

DESCRIPTION

MADE FOR YOU, YOUR HEADPHONES & SPEAKERS

Nobody's perfect, including your headphone and a little bit of tuning goes a long way. The Loki is the best tone control device that lets you get the most out of your headphones or speakers. You don't even need to be satisfied with just reducing imperfections, get your music to sound the way you want. Whether you are a bass head, revel in the mids or simply enjoy new highs; The Loki tunes your music to your tastes.

THE MODERN EQUALISER

Remember that time when equalizers used to be a stack of noisy op-amps and dust collecting sliders? Well, the Loki has certainly made life easier with its flexibility and transparency. Did you just ask how? Well, firstly, it has a gyrator for the bass. Sounds cool? Let’s move on. It also has a current feedback gain stage and passive LC filters for 3 bands. Lastly, it uses Alps potentiometers for better control.

SPECS

SPECIFICATIONS

FREQUENCY RESPONSE
20Hz-20Khz, -0.1db 2Hz-850KHz, -3dB

MAXIMUM OUPUT
10V RMS into 10K ohms

THD
Less than 0.002%, 20Hz-20KHz, at 2V RMS in/out, pots centered, active stage enabled, less than 0.01% at any potentiometer setting

IMD
Less than 0.002%, CCIF

SNR
Greater than 109db, unweighted, referenced to 1V RMS

CROSSTALK
-80dB, 20Hz-20KHz

OUTPUT IMPEDANCE
75 ohms

INPUT IMPEDANCE
47K ohms

BANDS
20Hz, 400Hz, 2kHz, 8kHz

ADJUSTMENT
+/-12dB at 20Hz and 8kHz, +/-6dB at 400Hz and 2kHz

TOPOLOGY
fully discrete, all-bipolar, symmetrical current-feedback design with no capacitors in the signal path and DC servo

FILTERING
Capacitor-gyrator for 20Hz, capacitor-inductor (LC) for all other bands

POWER CONSUMPTION
4W

WEIGHT
453g (1 lb)

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS

1. Schiit Loki

2. Wall-Wart

FAQs

What is the difference between the Schiit Loki and other equalizers?

The Schiit Loki is a lot more sleeker, transparent and flexible than other equalizers. Of course, if you still prefer the old noisy ones with dusty sliders; we are not judging.

What kind of an equalizer is this?

The Schiit Loki is a single-gain-stage active equalizer. It also has non-constant-Q passive filtering. Translation: Each band in this equalizer changes from broad to narrow as the gain is increased.

Will it give me a more true-to-life sound?

The Loki can fine-tune your audio to make it better. Whether it can sound like a recording artist in a studio? Hmmm.....It depends on what you are listening to and how much bass/treble you need.

Can I bypass it entirely if I get it?

After connecting it, you can bypass the equalizer simply by switching the switch in front. We did say it ranks high on transparency.

Is it portable?

Considering you need to connect it to a power outlet, we wouldn’t really recommend it as an on-the-go device.

Now hold on just a sec—are you saying we should use equalizers now?

Nope, you’re saying that. Not us.

But you just brought out this product!

Right. And, as you’ll note, it’s a standalone product. You can add it to your system if you’d like, or act like it doesn’t exist. It won’t add itself to your cart if you happen to buy, say, a Modi Multibit (or anything else.)

Buuuutttt…we thought you were crazy minimalist audiophile types who’d put their nose up in the air at the very thought of EQ?

As with the previous question, there’s nothing stopping you from assembling a minimalist, no-tone-control system from our extensive product line. Adding Loki is a choice you can make. If you’d like. No pressure.

So why bring this out now? What changed?

The world changed, and we decided to experiment a bit. That’s it in a nutshell. The longer explanation includes the fact that tone controls have pretty much become verboten over the last three decades in high-end audio. For those of you who remember some crappy tone control and EQ implementations, including dull, veiled, nasty-sounding knobs on the front of receivers and noisy, truly awful-sounding banks of 10 to 30 sliders (usually fixed in a death-grin), you know that there’s a good reason tone controls went away. But we decided to take a look at it and see what we could make with a single gain stage (rather than 10-30 op-amps in a row) and using passive LC (inductor-capacitor) filtering wherever possible. And we found that we could create an extremely transparent equalizer that allowed for some very nice control over tonal characteristics, without the downside of traditional tone controls or EQs. So we decided to make it and see if you find it interesting as well.

But…why EQ?

Because we live in an imperfect world, and because individuals have individual preferences. Nobody can say their speakers or headphones are ruler-flat. Nobody can say that all of their recordings are audiophile-quality. Loki provides a way to adjust for imperfect systems and imperfect recordings.

But…buuuuttt…is this true to the original recording? Is it what the artist intended?

If it sounds good to you, who cares?

Aieeeee! You’re making my head hurt! I don’t like options!

Cool. Then don’t get a Loki. Nobody’s making you buy it.

Well, if I do get it, can I bypass it?

Yes. There’s a switch on the front to completely bypass the tone control stage—as in, a relay connects the input and output directly, no active devices in the signal path at all.

Wow, so I guess you guys really think this is transparent, if it’s that easy to A-B the input and output.

Yes, we do think Loki is very transparent.

Let’s talk tech. What kind of EQ is this? Parametric?

No. Technically, Loki is a single-gain-stage active EQ with non-constant-Q passive filtering. In more English-y terms, that means that each band varies from broad to narrower as its gain is increased—small turns of the knobs result in broad, shallow changes, and bigger turns result in more narrow-band changes.

This gain stage, is it like Jotunheim’s Pivot Point topology?

It’s similar, yes, in that it is a fully discrete, current-feedback topology, but it is single-ended.

Whoa. Wait a sec, are you saying you’re giving us a discrete, single-gain-stage, passive LC-filtered EQ, the most purist approach to tone controls…for $149? Are you nuts?

We do like high value, but we’re not crazy. At least not as an official diagnosis.

What if I want a constant-Q EQ, or a parametric EQ?

That’s cool. There are some of those out there. They just won’t be Loki.

What about software EQ?

If you’d like to use software EQ (supplied with many playback software packages these days), that’s certainly an option—and you can probably get your parametric EQ there, if that’s what you want. However, you may prefer Loki…and once you get away from a computer source, an external hardware EQ is necessary if you want tone control.

What about the name, you’re re-using that, right?

Yep! Loki is the trickster god in Norse mythology. And it’s a neat name for a tricky little product. Now that we’re off the DSD train, it’s perfect for reviving a whole new category of products.

I noticed on the PC board you’re calling this Loki Mini. Are there other Lokis coming?

Come on, now, you know we don’t discuss future products. However, we’re always open to expanding the line in meaningful ways if this model does well—including coming up with a family of Lokis with different capabilities and at different price points. After all, Loki is a trickster, ever-changing.

WARRANTY & MEDIA REVIEWS

2 Year Warranty
Don't sweat it, this Schiit Loki comes with a 2 year warranty from Schiit that covers manufacturing defects. All products featured on Headphone Zone are backed by an original manufacturer's warranty. Read more about Schiit's warranty in India.

"I found Loki particularly useful with headphones, where for example I could bump up the deep bass to add weight to the sound, and tame brightness by shelving down 8 kHz."
Read More

title: Schiit - Magni
description:
Designed & Made in the USA

2 Years of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Indoor Use

Connect With RCA

2.4W RMS @ 32Ω Power Output

Metal Build

Volume Controls

DESCRIPTION

NOT JUST ANY BEGINNER'S AMP

Experience the power, performance, low noise and versatility that brings out the best in any headphone with the Schiit Magni 3+/ Magni Heresy. From sensitive IEMs to power-hungry headphones, these Schiit amps can handle them all. With 2400mW into 32Ω, switchable gain & an exceptionally low noise floor, you get a high-performance amp.

CHOOSE BETWEEN TWO POWERFUL VARIANTS

Schiit gives you a choice between a very powerful amp and an extremely powerful amp. The Magni 3+ is an affordable mini speaker amp with a Vbe multiplier and driver stage. It's the ultimate all-discrete current-feedback headphone amp. The Magni Heresy is an all-op-amp based headphone amp. It includes a multiple paralleled output stage with feedforward that offers some really awesome measurements.

DESIGNED & BUILT IN THE USA

Both amps have been designed and built in the United States. The Magni 3+ features the traditional silver and grey chassis while the Magni Heresy sports a fancy black and red chassis. They include preamp outputs, letting you connect to desktop powered monitors as well as speaker power amps. Thanks to built-in instant shut-down and time-delayed start-up, say goodbye to glitches or pops.

SPECS
Magni 3+

SPECIFICATIONS

FREQUENCY RESPONSE
20Hz-20Khz, +/-0.04dB

MAXIMUM POWER
Maximum Power, 16 ohms: 2.8W RMS per channel Maximum Power, 32 ohms: 2.4W RMS per channel Maximum Power, 50 ohms: 1.6W RMS per channel Maximum Power, 300 ohms: 410mW RMS per channel Maximum Power, 600 ohms: 215mW RMS per channel

THD
High Gain: Less than 0.0013% (-98dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms Low Gain: Less than 0.0005% (-106dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms

IMD
High Gain: Less than 0.01% (-80dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms, CCIF Low Gain: Less than 0.002% (-95dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms, CCIF

SNR
High Gain: Greater than 104dB, A weighted, referenced to 1V RMS Low Gain: Greater than 115dB, A weighted, referenced to 1V RMS

CROSSTALK
Less than -70dB, 20 Hz-20 kHz in either gain

OUTPUT IMPEDANCE
Less than 0.2 ohms at either gain

INPUT IMPEDANCE
25k ohms

GAIN
1 (0db) or 5.5 (15db), selectable via rear switch

TOPOLOGY
Fully discrete, fully complementary all-bipolar, symmetrical current-feedback design with driver stage and Vbe multiplier, no capacitors in the signal path and DC servo

PROTECTION
Standard failsafe DC power input and muting relay

POWER SUPPLY
“Wall wart” style 24VA 14VAC transformer, regulated +/- 16V rails with over 6,000uF filter capacitance

POWER CONSUMPTION
6W

SIZE
5 x 3.5 x 1.25”

WEIGHT
1 lb

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS

1. Schiit Magni 3+

2. Wall-Wart 15VAC, 1.5A

Magni Heresy

SPECIFICATIONS

FREQUENCY RESPONSE
20Hz-20Khz, +/-0.04dB

MAXIMUM POWER
Maximum Power, 16 ohms: 2.8W RMS per channel Maximum Power, 32 ohms: 2.4W RMS per channel Maximum Power, 50 ohms: 1.6W RMS per channel Maximum Power, 300 ohms: 410mW RMS per channel Maximum Power, 600 ohms: 215mW RMS per channel

THD
High Gain: Less than 0.0014% (-97dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms Low Gain: Less than 0.0002% (-113dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms

IMD
High Gain: Less than 0.002% (-95dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms, CCIF Less than 0.0006% (-105dB) at 1V RMS into 32 ohms, CCIF

SNR
High Gain: Greater than 104dB, A weighted, referenced to 1V RMS Low Gain: Greater than 115dB, A weighted, referenced to 1V RMS

CROSSTALK
Less than -70dB, 20 Hz-20 kHz in either gain

OUTPUT IMPEDANCE
Less than 0.25 ohms at either gain

INPUT IMPEDANCE
25k ohms

GAIN
1 (0db) or 5.5 (15db), selectable via rear switch

TOPOLOGY
OPA1662 op-amp for voltage gain with local feedback, OPA1688 (8 stages) as output buffers with local loops, no overall loop feedback.

PROTECTION
Standard failsafe DC power input and muting relay

POWER SUPPLY
“Wall wart” style 24VA 15VAC transformer, regulated +/- 16V rails with over 6,000uF filter capacitance

POWER CONSUMPTION
6W

SIZE
5 x 3.5 x 1.25”

WEIGHT
1 lb

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS

1. Schiit Magni Heresy

2. Wall-Wart 15VAC, 1.5A

FAQs

Wait a sec, there are two Magnis now? Why U make me choose?!?

Because some people really like our historic approach to Magni, and some people want even better measurements. So we decided to give you both: a Magni 3+ that is the ultimate expression of our discrete, current-feedback topology (basically a small speaker amp) and a Magni Heresy that is 100% integrated—all op-amps, all the time..

Why would I choose one over the other?

Because you like silver and gray, which is the finish of Magni 3+, or black and red, which are Magni Heresy's colors.

No, seriously!

I think we covered this in the product description, but here goes again, with more detail ● Magni 3+: choose this one if you want an all-discrete headphone amp. Discrete means its made up of lots of individual transistors (well, actually a lot of paired matched transistors now). It’s essentially a mini speaker amp. In fact, the topology is exactly that of a 2-stage speaker amp now, since we added a driver stage and Vbe multiplier for biasing. The driver reduces distortion and the Vbe multiplier means the bias is more stable. It's a super-advanced amp, and we’re very proud of it. ● Magni Heresy: choose this one if you want a 100% op-amp-based headphone amp that delivers spectacular measurements. Thank the high-quality op-amps used: OPA1662 for gain, OPA1688 for output—eight (8) OPA1688 stages per channel, for low output impedance and very high current capability. With these advanced parts (the OPA1688 even uses feedforward in its topology), we’re getting 6-8dB lower THD+N than Magni 3+, which is already 10-15dB lower THD+N than Magni 3.

Which one sounds better?

Ah hell no, we aren’t falling for that. You tell us.

At least give us a hint!

We think both amps sound very, very good, or else we wouldn’t offer both of them. We developed the Magni Heresy largely to see what could be accomplished with a simple topology and modern op-amps, but we’re very pleased with the way it came out. At the same time, we think Magni 3+ provides compelling reasons that you shouldn’t choose everything simply based on numbers. But seriously, you tell us.

Why the name “Heresy?”

When we started developing an all-op-amp Magni, it was 100% counter to everything we’ve done. We’ve always done fully discrete designs, when we weren’t so cost-constrained that they weren’t practical. Going op-amp was far, far easier, and more typical in today’s world, but it was, well, almost anathema. So to us, an op-amp Magni was heresy. But we’re happy with the way it turned out!

If Heresy is so good, why’d you bother with Magni 3+?

That’s a great question, isn’t it? Why would we bother with a much more complex, harder to produce product that takes a lot more engineering time and skill (the Magni 3+)? Well, we believe that the numbers don’t tell the entire story. We believe that Magni 3+ has a place. But when it comes down to it, it’s your call.

Why is it a “Magni 3+” and not a “Magni 4?”

Why is it a 6S or 8 but not 9 or 10S but 11? Nah, sorry, just teasing you, Apple fans. There’s a method to our madness. For us, a product gets a “+” when it has the same functionality, but has been changed significantly internally. Like Freya+ and Saga+. A product gets a number bump if the functionality changes.

So which one is quiet enough for IEMs?

Both of them will run IEMs with zero audible noise, though Magni Heresy is slightly quieter on the analyzer.

So which one is powerful enough for inefficient, planar magnetic headphones?

Both of them have tons of power—specifically 2.4W RMS per channel at less than 1% THD, though both typically perform comfortably above that.

How do you keep getting more and more power out of Magni with every iteration?

Simple: we keep tweaking for higher efficiency. Last time it was a topology change. This time it’s a driver stage and optimized emitter resistance. It is about the maximum of what we can do now, though, without giant changes.

What’s this about DC coupling?

Either Magni has no capacitors in the signal path at all—that’s what we mean by DC coupling. This eliminates any sonic effect a capacitor in the signal path might have on your system.

So you probably cheaped out and left the protection off these amps, or something stupid like that, right?

No. Both Magnis have relay mute for delayed startup and fast shut-down. You can leave your headphones plugged in all the time. It also automatically disconnects the preamp outputs when you plug headphones in. Amazing things, switches.

These sound so great! Why would I buy any of your other amps?

Seriously, you really don’t need to. But, you know, different people like different things, and they may want to try out tube amps, or balanced amps, or Class A/Continuity™ amps, or you might have Raal/Requisite headphones, and then you actually need a different amp, the Jotunheim R, the only direct drive ribbon headphone amp.

I want a combined DAC/amp! Why didn’t you put a DAC in here?

We did. They’re just in a different chassis and costs another $99-249. They’re called “Modi 3” or “Modi Multibit.”

Hey, so does that mean I can plug in some uber-special, gold-plated, cryo-treated, 85-lb 2000VA wall wart and have even better performance?

Unless you know what you’re doing, we don’t recommend that. Magni uses an AC wall wart. Most are DC. DC won’t work with either Magni. Plus, seriously? This is a $99 amp. You want to use some $599 power supply with it? Nah.

What the hell is a Magni?

In Norse mythology, Magni was one of Thor’s sons.

DOWNLOADS
Schiit Magni 3+/Heresy Manual
Magni 3+/Heresy Chapter (from the ongoing Schiit Happened book)
WARRANTY & MEDIA REVIEWS

2 Year Warranty
Don't sweat it, this Schiit Magni comes with a 2 year warranty from Schiit that covers manufacturing defects. All products featured on Headphone Zone are backed by an original manufacturer's warranty. Read more about Schiit's warranty in India.

"By that fact alone, I think my ears pick up more clarity through the Magni than they have with any portable amplifier I have ever heard."
Read More

IN THE BOX

BOX CONTENTS

1. Schiit Magni Heresy

2. Wall-Wart 15VAC, 1.5A

FAQs

Wait a sec, there are two Magnis now? Why U make me choose?!?

Because some people really like our historic approach to Magni, and some people want even better measurements. So we decided to give you both: a Magni 3+ that is the ultimate expression of our discrete, current-feedback topology (basically a small speaker amp) and a Magni Heresy that is 100% integrated—all op-amps, all the time..

Why would I choose one over the other?

Because you like silver and gray, which is the finish of Magni 3+, or black and red, which are Magni Heresy's colors.

No, seriously!

I think we covered this in the product description, but here goes again, with more detail ● Magni 3+: choose this one if you want an all-discrete headphone amp. Discrete means its made up of lots of individual transistors (well, actually a lot of paired matched transistors now). It’s essentially a mini speaker amp. In fact, the topology is exactly that of a 2-stage speaker amp now, since we added a driver stage and Vbe multiplier for biasing. The driver reduces distortion and the Vbe multiplier means the bias is more stable. It's a super-advanced amp, and we’re very proud of it. ● Magni Heresy: choose this one if you want a 100% op-amp-based headphone amp that delivers spectacular measurements. Thank the high-quality op-amps used: OPA1662 for gain, OPA1688 for output—eight (8) OPA1688 stages per channel, for low output impedance and very high current capability. With these advanced parts (the OPA1688 even uses feedforward in its topology), we’re getting 6-8dB lower THD+N than Magni 3+, which is already 10-15dB lower THD+N than Magni 3.

Which one sounds better?

Ah hell no, we aren’t falling for that. You tell us.

At least give us a hint!

We think both amps sound very, very good, or else we wouldn’t offer both of them. We developed the Magni Heresy largely to see what could be accomplished with a simple topology and modern op-amps, but we’re very pleased with the way it came out. At the same time, we think Magni 3+ provides compelling reasons that you shouldn’t choose everything simply based on numbers. But seriously, you tell us.

Why the name “Heresy?”

When we started developing an all-op-amp Magni, it was 100% counter to everything we’ve done. We’ve always done fully discrete designs, when we weren’t so cost-constrained that they weren’t practical. Going op-amp was far, far easier, and more typical in today’s world, but it was, well, almost anathema. So to us, an op-amp Magni was heresy. But we’re happy with the way it turned out!

If Heresy is so good, why’d you bother with Magni 3+?

That’s a great question, isn’t it? Why would we bother with a much more complex, harder to produce product that takes a lot more engineering time and skill (the Magni 3+)? Well, we believe that the numbers don’t tell the entire story. We believe that Magni 3+ has a place. But when it comes down to it, it’s your call.

Why is it a “Magni 3+” and not a “Magni 4?”

Why is it a 6S or 8 but not 9 or 10S but 11? Nah, sorry, just teasing you, Apple fans. There’s a method to our madness. For us, a product gets a “+” when it has the same functionality, but has been changed significantly internally. Like Freya+ and Saga+. A product gets a number bump if the functionality changes.

So which one is quiet enough for IEMs?

Both of them will run IEMs with zero audible noise, though Magni Heresy is slightly quieter on the analyzer.

So which one is powerful enough for inefficient, planar magnetic headphones?

Both of them have tons of power—specifically 2.4W RMS per channel at less than 1% THD, though both typically perform comfortably above that.

How do you keep getting more and more power out of Magni with every iteration?

Simple: we keep tweaking for higher efficiency. Last time it was a topology change. This time it’s a driver stage and optimized emitter resistance. It is about the maximum of what we can do now, though, without giant changes.

What’s this about DC coupling?

Either Magni has no capacitors in the signal path at all—that’s what we mean by DC coupling. This eliminates any sonic effect a capacitor in the signal path might have on your system.

So you probably cheaped out and left the protection off these amps, or something stupid like that, right?

No. Both Magnis have relay mute for delayed startup and fast shut-down. You can leave your headphones plugged in all the time. It also automatically disconnects the preamp outputs when you plug headphones in. Amazing things, switches.

These sound so great! Why would I buy any of your other amps?

Seriously, you really don’t need to. But, you know, different people like different things, and they may want to try out tube amps, or balanced amps, or Class A/Continuity™ amps, or you might have Raal/Requisite headphones, and then you actually need a different amp, the Jotunheim R, the only direct drive ribbon headphone amp.

I want a combined DAC/amp! Why didn’t you put a DAC in here?

We did. They’re just in a different chassis and costs another $99-249. They’re called “Modi 3” or “Modi Multibit.”

Hey, so does that mean I can plug in some uber-special, gold-plated, cryo-treated, 85-lb 2000VA wall wart and have even better performance?

Unless you know what you’re doing, we don’t recommend that. Magni uses an AC wall wart. Most are DC. DC won’t work with either Magni. Plus, seriously? This is a $99 amp. You want to use some $599 power supply with it? Nah.

What the hell is a Magni?

In Norse mythology, Magni was one of Thor’s sons.

description:
Designed & Made in USA

Warm & Smooth Sound Signature

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Indoor Use

The Audeze LCD2C is still the greatest Planar Magnetic Headphones in this segment. The bass and warmth that you'd expect from an Audeze make them ideal for anyone starting their journey and looking for serious high-end headphones. Pair it with a good desktop Amp to make them sing.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.

DESCRIPTION

NEW HEADPHONE, SAME SOUND

What do you get when you take the LCD-2's drivers and remove the Fazor elements? The warm and energetic sound of the Audeze LCD-2 Classic. Seeing the popularity of the original LCD-2, Audeze decided to bring it back in a new & improved version — the LCD-2 Classic.

AUDEZE'S PLANAR MAGNETIC MAGIC

Unlike a dynamic driver with a cone or dome attached to a round voice coil, Audeze's flat, thin-film diaphragm has a printed circuit across most of its surface. When the circuit is energized with an audio signal it interacts with the magnets that move the diaphragm back and forth, creating a larger than life sound. Further, the double-sided magnet arrays deliver a uniform driving force across the entire diaphragm for a near-zero distortion.

HANDCRAFTED WITH PREMIUM MATERIALS

Made in the USA, the Audeze LCD-2 Classic are handcrafted using high-quality luxurious materials. It features Audeze's tonal balance and powerful bass that beautifully articulates the power and nuance of your favourite music. The gorgeous wooden rings are designed for the audiophile with a discerning ear & style.

MIX & MASTER ANYWHERE & EVERYWHERE

Not everyone can listen to their headphones in an acoustically treated room. With the Audeze Reveal plugin, you can add custom filter presets to all Audeze flagships. Now, mix and master in virtually any location, be it the studio, your home or even on top of an active volcano.

What is the warranty period on Audeze LCD2 Classics and how do I claim warranty?

The warranty period of the Audeze LCD2 Classics is for 3 years. In order to claim warranty, please visit our Audeze warranty page. We are very helpful guys, just saying.

Where are these headphones made?

Audeze headphones are engineered and handcrafted in the USA to our exacting quality standards.

How does the Audeze LCD 2 Classics sound?

The Audeze LCD 2 Classics sound very warm and energytic.

Will these leak sound?

Yes, Since it an open back headphone it will leak sound. So people next to you will be able to listen to the music you listen. Sharing is Caring.

Will It need an Amp?

Yes, to bring the best of this headphone an Amp is recommended. You could have a look at our collection of DAC/Amps here.

Do I really need an Amp though?

We have an article that should help understand why an Amp is important. Read about it here

Is the carry case provided with the product?

Unfortunately, it does not come with any carry case. Bummer!

Can the LCD 2 Classics be used in a 3.5mm headphone output?

Yes, you will simply need the 6.5mm to 3.5mm adapter.

What is the difference between LCD 2 Classics and LCD 2?

Audeze have taken the current generation LCD-2 drivers and removed the Fazor elements, aligning the sound of the LCD-2 Classic with that of the original LCD-2 launched in 2008.

DESCRIPTION

WELCOME TO THE WORLD OF EAR SPEAKERS, HI-CLASS SOUND

The innovative SR-L300 is, like all the others in Stax’s Lambra series, an ultra-high fidelity device due to its electrostatic technology. It produces a sound that would only be comparable to other loudspeakers (& not headphones). Hence, it is only fair that this headset be called an Earspeaker. Keeping in line with its predecessors, the SR-L300 has top notch sound quality. Stainless photo etched electrodes are fixed securely for a clear transparent audio. The headphone gives a balanced sound with delicate highs, soothing mids and a deep bass.

WHY ELECTROSTATIC HEADPHONES?, LET YOUR MUSIC SOUND ITS BEST

Electrostatic designed have been pioneered by Stax and they are clearly at the top of the game. The electrostatic headphones operate on a an unconventional level unlike other headphones that feature dynamic and moving coil designs. In most headphones, the drivers are heavier, making it difficult to recreate detail in playback due to mass. To keep the quality of music from deteriorating, the Stax SR-L300 uses an Oxygen Free Copper (OFC). This cable uses a wide flat structure to reduce the capacitance between wires and to drive it effectively so that your music always sounds its best.

ARTIFICIAL LEATHER EARPADS, EXTREME COMFORT

Everything about the SR-L300 is made to enhance the sound and your listening experience. This also includes the artificial leather earpads. The flexibility of these earpads provides added comfort while letting you feel the freshness of your music. The SR-L300 is made for comfortable listening. The stepless slider mechanism, lets you adjust the soft headpad for a better fit. This avoids fatigue and enables you to entirely immerse yourself in the music.

title: Headphone Zone - Helix Headphone Stand
description:
DESCRIPTION
We conducted a survey and found that over 88% of headphone owners didn't have a dedicated place to keep their expensive headphones. While some resigned to seeing their headphones casually strewn over a desk, a large portion of our study showed that headphones are well hidden away from view, either in a drawer, or packed neatly in their hard cases or packaging.
The question was on everyone's mind."How do I make my headphones more accessible?" Headphones are a prized possession and we found that one should take pride in presenting them.
That's when we decided to recreate the elegant Omega SE Headphone Stand, a handcrafted detachable wooden stand available in two different wooden finishes: Birch and Walnut.
A Headphone Zone product, we're confident that this stand is definitely going to change the look of your table top.
Detachable and Portable headphone stand
Omega SE is made detachable so that you can carry your stand anywhere and everywhere. It's lightweight and portable so that it's easy to carry.
Handcrafted Luxury
The Omega SE stand is handcrafted from wood that is sourced from sustainably forested woodland. It is quite heavy to hold and feels durable to the touch.
Shaped like an Omega
The conturing shape of the Omega SE resembles the natural shape of a human head. This means, that one needn't worry about the headphone's structure being altered or degraded over time.
Fit for all Headphones
All headphones, large or small can enjoy the luxury of this stand. These easily take the weight of all headphones, and also complement most of them.
Birch Wood Finish
Birch wood finishes, often a substitute for maple wood, are a very popular craftwood option for its smooth lines and soft colours. It's very easy on the eyes. We love the wonderful fine and uniform texture.

Walnut Wood Finish
This beautiful dark wood stand is easily one of the most alluring. Typically found in music instruments and super plush furniture, walnut is a popular choice for the architecture with fine taste. They'd complement most headphones.

title: iFi Audio - iEMatch
description:
DESCRIPTION

THE PERFECT MATCH FOR YOUR AUDIO GEAR

Do you find that your headphones/ IEMs often have a background hiss from your source? All you need to do is connect the iFi Audio iEMatch to your headphone before plugging it into your source device and voila! You get a sound that's open & transparent. It is compatible with smartphones, PCs, DAPs and in-flight entertainment systems.

BRINGS BACK LOST RESOLUTION

Usually, at full volumes, music tends to lose at least 2-bits of resolution. The iEMatch brings back this lost resolution letting you increase the digital volume. It is compatible with all headphones and IEMS that use a 3.5mm, 2.5mm or 4.4mm jack. It comes with two sensitivity settings, High and Ultra Sensitivity to boost the sound.

BALANCED OR SINGLE-ENDED? IT'S YOUR CHOICE

The iEMatch easily switches between balanced and single-ended headphones & IEMs. Headphones fitted with a TRRS jack can alternate between a balanced mode to match DAPs, DACs and headphone amplifiers while the single-ended mode is compatible with smartphones. The ‘S-Balanced®’ TRRS system by iFi provides a way to select the TRRS plug to offer either a balanced connection or a single-ended one.

USES ONLY HIGH-QUALITY MATERIALS

The iEMatch uses 6063-TS aluminium and a 6N silver copper matrix for better signal transfer. Durable gold-plated TRRS-Balanced connectors complete the package. You also get memory foam earplugs along with an aeroplane adapter and travel pouch for in-flight use.

title: Astell&Kern - AK CD-Ripper-MKII
description:
Designed in Korea

1 Year of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Indoor Use

Connect With USB

DESCRIPTION

DESIGNED FOR BETTER PERFORMANCE

The Astell&Kern AK CD-Ripper MKII has been made to look good and stay functional. The new design offers a better CD ripping experience while maintaining the original AK CD-Ripper's stable performance. The rectangular insertion slot for the CD has a more vivid design. The increased weight and triangular support damper's spring structure limits vibrations from CD-rotation effectively.

WANT TO RIP CDS? HERE'S THE EASY WAY

CD ripping has never been this easy. Simply set-up the ripping options in advance and connect your A&K player with the AK CD-Ripper MKII with the provided cable. Then, all that's left to do is to tap the CD-Ripping Icon to begin. You can also rip CDs after connecting and activating the AK CD-RIPPER MKII from the player's Notification Bar. Note: The AK CD-RIPPER MKII may not be properly recognized when using a power supply adapter rated at less than 5V 2A.

YOUR MUSIC'S INFORMATION, NOW AT YOUR FINGERTIPS

After ripping, your connected Astell&Kern player will automatically access Gracenote's servers to add music information like the song name, artist's name, album, etc. as well as the album's cover. You can even manually add this information if it's not available on Gracenote. Furthermore, you can set the ripping speed (normal/fast /very fast) and file format (WAV / FLAC) via the settings menu.
